text.section: In this section, "reasonable fee" means a fee bearing a reasonable relationship to the recovery of actual costs incurred by a governmental unit.
Subject to the limitations in this section, the official custodian may charge an applicant a reasonable fee for the search for, preparation of, and reproduction of a public record.
The official custodian may not charge a fee for the first 2 hours that are needed to search for a public record and prepare it for inspection.

section.section: If another law sets a fee for a copy, printout, or photograph of a public record, that law applies.
The official custodian otherwise may charge any reasonable fee for making or supervising the making of a copy, printout, or photograph of a public record.
The official custodian may charge for the cost of providing facilities for the reproduction of the public record if the custodian did not have the facilities.

text.section:
The official custodian may waive a fee under this section if:
the applicant asks for a waiver; and
after consideration of the ability of the applicant to pay the fee and other relevant factors, the official custodian determines that the waiver would be in the public interest.
